alert.note: Alert for Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 08 at 11:16PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Schuylkill. * WHEN...Until 215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1113 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shenandoah, Frackville, Ashland, Tremont, Girardville, Lavelle, Altamont, Englewood, Forrestville, Branchdale, Donaldson, Fountain Springs, Heckscherville, Brandonville, Buck Run, Beurys Lake, Shenandoah Heights, Ringtown, Gilberton and Gordon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
